title: Luka_Dončić
extract: Luka Dončić is a Slovenian professional basketball player for the Los Angeles Lakers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). Since his rookie season, he has been selected to five NBA All-Star games and five All-NBA First Team selections. He also represents the Slovenian national team and is widely regarded as one of the greatest European players of all time.

title: Anthony_Davis
extract: Anthony Marshon Davis Jr., nicknamed "AD", is an American professional basketball player for the Dallas Mavericks of the National Basketball Association (NBA). He plays the power forward and center positions. Davis is a ten-time NBA All-Star and has been named to four All-NBA First Teams and five NBA All-Defensive Teams. After starting his career with the New Orleans Pelicans, he won the 2020 NBA Finals in his first season with the Los Angeles Lakers. In 2021, he was named to the NBA 75th Anniversary Team. He also won the inaugural NBA Cup in 2023 with the Lakers.

'''Anthony Marshon Davis Jr.''' (born March 11, 1993), nicknamed "'''AD'''", is an American professional [[basketball]] player for the [[Dallas Mavericks]] of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA). He plays the [[Power forward (basketball)|power forward]] and [[Center (basketball)|center]] positions. Davis is a ten-time [[NBA All-Star]] and has been named to four [[All-NBA First Team]]s and five [[NBA All-Defensive Team]]s.  After starting his career with the [[New Orleans Pelicans]], he won the [[2020 NBA Finals]] in his first season with the [[Los Angeles Lakers]]. title: 67th_Annual_Grammy_Awards
extract: The 67th Annual Grammy Awards honored the best recordings, compositions, and artists from September 16, 2023, to August 30, 2024, as chosen by the members of the Recording Academy, on February 2, 2025. In its 22nd year at Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles, the main ceremony was broadcast on CBS and available to stream on Paramount+. It was preceded by the premiere ceremony at the Peacock Theater, starting at 12:30 p.m. PT. Nominations were announced through a YouTube livestream on November 8, 2024. South African comedian Trevor Noah hosted the ceremony for the fifth consecutive time.

Beyoncé’s Historic Win & Kanye’s SHOCKING Exit! |date=2025-02-04 |last=Celebrity What If |access-date=2025-02-04 |via=YouTube}}{{Cite web |last=Ruggieri |first=Melissa |last2=McClellan |first2=Jennifer |date=November 8, 2024 |title=2025 Grammy nominations live updates: Beyoncé leads the way |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2024/11/08/grammy-nominations-2025-live-updates/76071876007/ |access-date=November 25, 2024 |website=[[USA Today]] |language=en-US}} In its 22nd year at [[Crypto.com Arena]] in [[Los Angeles]], the main ceremony was broadcast on [[CBS]] and available to stream on [[Paramount+]]. It was preceded by the premiere ceremony at the [[Peacock Theater]], starting at 12:30 p.m. PT. Nominations were announced through a [[YouTube]] livestream on November 8, 2024.{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/music-news/grammy-awards-date-2025-1235904989/|date=May 21, 2024|title=Grammy Awards to Air Live in February 2025|last=Fekadu|first=Mesfin|access-date=May 21, 2024|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|archive-date=October 7, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241007193602/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/music-news/grammy-awards-date-2025-1235904989/|url-status=live}} South African comedian [[Trevor Noah]] hosted the ceremony for the fifth consecutive time.{{Cite web |last=Czachor |first=Emily Mae |date=January 21, 2025 |title=Trevor Noah returns to host 2025 Grammy Awards |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trevor-noah-host-2025-grammy-awards/ |access-date=January 21, 2025 |website=[[CBS News]] |language=en-US |archive-date=January 21, 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250121152239/https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trevor-noah-host-2025-grammy-awards/ |url-status=live }} [[Kendrick Lamar]]'s "[[Not Like Us]]" swept all five of its nominations, which included [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year|Record of the Year]] and [[Grammy Award for Song of the Year|Song of the Year]], making it the most decorated rap song in Grammy history. He became the second rap artist to win both awards, after [[Childish Gambino]] in [[61st Annual Grammy Awards|2019]].{{Cite news |last=Coscarelli |first=Joe |date=2025-02-03 |title=Kendrick Lamar’s ‘Not Like Us’ Wins Record and Song of the Year |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2025/02/02/arts/music/kendrick-lamar-not-like-us-record-of-the-year.html |access-date=2025-02-03 |work=The New York Times |language=en-US |issn=0362-4331}} [[Beyoncé]] received the most nominations at the ceremony with eleven and won three awards, which included [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|Album of the Year]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Country Album|Best Country Album]] for ''[[Cowboy Carter]]''. She became the first Black artist to win Best Country Album and the first Black woman to win Album of the Year since [[Lauryn Hill]] in [[41st Annual Grammy Awards|1999]].{{Cite web |date=2025-02-02 |title=Beyoncé wins album of the year at the 2025 Grammys for 'Cowboy Carter' |url=https://apnews.com/article/grammy-awards-2025-a0e1a23256cd903a913c811ff75f10f8 |access-date=2025-02-03 |website=AP News |language=en}} [[Chappell Roan]] took home [[Grammy Award for Best New Artist|Best New Artist]], and [[Sierra Ferrell]] swept the American roots categories, winning all four of her nominations. {{Cite web |date=2025-02-03 |title=Chappell Roan wins best new artist Grammy Award |url=https://apnews.com/article/grammy-best-new-artist-2025-d68754cb398ebef06b47a3c6b2dc3a92 |access-date=2025-02-03 |website=AP News |language=en}} Best New Artist nominee [[Doechii]] won [[Best Rap Album]] for ''[[Alligator Bites Never Heal]],'' becoming the third woman to win this award, after Hill (with the [[Fugees]]) in [[39th Annual Grammy Awards|1997]] and [[Cardi B]] in [[61st Annual Grammy Awards|2019]]. First time nominee, [[Sabrina Carpenter]], won her first Grammys for [[Best Pop Solo Performance]] and [[Best Pop Album]

title: Groundhog_Day
extract: Groundhog Day is a tradition observed regionally in the United States and Canada on February 2 of every year. It derives from the Pennsylvania Dutch superstition that if a groundhog emerges from its burrow on this day and sees its shadow, it will retreat to its den and winter will go on for six more weeks; if it does not see its shadow, spring will arrive early. In 2025, the shadow was seen, auguring six more weeks of winter.
text:
{{short description|Popular North American tradition}}

{{Infobox holiday
| holiday_name  = Groundhog Day

| image         = Punxsutawney Phil Groundhog Day 2022 Pennsylvania (51858203861).jpg
| caption       = 2022 celebration in [[Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania]], US
| observedby    = {{hlist|[[United States]]|[[Canada]]}}
| duration      = 1 day
| frequency     = Annual
| date          = February 2
| mdy           = yes
| celebrations  = Announcing whether a [[groundhog]] sees its shadow after it emerges from its [[burrow]]
| significance  = [[Weather lore|Predicts]] the arrival of spring
| relatedto     = [[Candlemas]]
| alt           = Two smiling men dressed in formal attire stand beside each other. Other people and bare trees are visible in the background. The man on the left holds a groundhog in his arms. The man on the right, wearing an earpiece, holds forward an open scroll, which reads in small text:
"HEAR YE, HEAR YE, HEAR YE.
TODAY, 2-2-22, WELCOME TO PUNXSUTAWNEY TO CELEBRATE GROUNDHOG DAY, THE ONE HUNDRED THIRTY SIXTH ANNUAL TREK OF THE PUNXSUTAWNEY GROUNDHOG CLUB.
PUNXSUTAWNEY PHIL, THE SEER OF SEERS, THE PROGNOSTICATOR OF ALL PROGNOSTICATORS, WAS GENTLY LIFTED FROM HIS BURROW AT 7:25 AM, AND HELD HIGH TO SEE. HIS FAITHFUL FOLLOWERS HAD RETURNED WITH GLEE!
PLACING PHIL ON TOP OF THE STUMP, WHERE IN GROUNDHOGESE, HE DIRECTED THE PRESIDENT, JEFF LUNDY, AND THE INNER CIRCLE TO HIS PREDICTION SCROLL THAT READS:
WINTER HAS BEEN BLEAK AND DARK AND BEREFT OF HOPE. YET WINTER IS JUST ANOTHER STEP IN THE CYCLE OF LIFE. AS I LOOK OUT OVER THE FACES OF THE TRUE BELIEVERS FROM AROUND THE WORLD, I BASK IN THE WARMTH OF YOUR HEARTS. I COULDN'T IMAGINE A BETTER FATE, WITH MY SHADOW I HAVE CAST, THAN A LONG AND LUSTROUS SIX MORE WEEKS OF WINTER."
}}
'''Groundhog Day''' ({{langx|pdc|Grund'sau dåk}}, {{lang|pdc|Grundsaudaag}}, {{lang|pdc|Grundsow Dawg}}, {{lang|pdc|Murmeltiertag}}; [[Lunenburg County, Nova Scotia|Lunenburg, Nova Scotia]]: Daks Day)<ref name="Poteet 2004">{{citation |last=Poteet |first=Lewis J. |title=The South Shore Phrase Book |place=Hantsport |publisher=[[Methuen Publishing|Methuen]] |year=2008 |isbn=9780595311941 |orig-year=1975 |url=}}</ref><ref>{{citation |last=Chambers |first=Jack |title=Canadian English: Origins and Structures |edition=New, revised, and expanded |place=Hantsport |publisher=[[Lancelot Press]] |year=2004 |isbn=9780595311941 |orig-year=1988 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=z1wyJRyDk3UC&pg=PT36 |access-date=December 26, 2017 |archive-date=August 2, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200802184805/https://books.google.com/books?id=z1wyJRyDk3UC&pg=PT36 |url-status=live</ref><ref>{{cite thesis |last=Wilson |first=Harry |date=1959 |title=The dialect of Lunenburg County, Nova Scotia: a study of the English of the county, with reference to its sources, preservation of relics, and vestiges of bilingualism |url=https://www.proquest.com/openview/d0a3a8fd88a97d3bea7b2b6103492837/1?pq-origsite=gscholar&cbl=18750&diss=y |degree=PhD |publisher=[[University of Michigan]]|page=52|access-date=February 3, 2024}}</ref>is a tradition observed regionally in the United States and Canada on February 2 of every year. It derives from the [[Pennsylvania Dutch]] superstition that if a [[groundhog]] emerges from its burrow on this day and sees its shadow, it will retreat to its den and winter will go on for six more weeks; if it does not see its shadow, spring will arrive early. In 2025, the shadow was seen, auguring six more weeks of winter.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |title=Did the groundhog see his shadow? See results of Punxsutawney Phil's 2025 winter forecast |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2025/02/02/groundhog-day-2025-punxsutawney-phil-live-updates/78138744007/ |access-date=2025-02-02 |website=USA TODAY |language=en-US}}</ref>

While the tradition remains popular in the 21st century, studies have found no consistent association between a groundhog seeing its shadow and the subsequent arrival time of spring-like weather.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lewis |first=Tanya |date=February 2, 2017 |title=Groundhog Day: How Often Does Punxsutawney Phil Get It Right? |url=https://www.livescience.com/49665-groundhog-day-predictions.html |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170208235332/http://www.livescience.com/49665-groundhog-day-predictions.html |archive-date=February 8, 2017 |website=Live Science}}</ref> The [[weather lore]] was brought from German-speaking areas where the [[badger]] ({{langx|de|link=no|Dachs}}) is the forecasting animal, while in [[Hungary]] for example the [[bear]] serves the same purpose,<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nemzet |first=Magyar |date=2024-01-28 |title=Hogy mikor jön a tavasz, napokon belül kiderül |url=https://magyarnemzet.hu/belfold/2024/01/hogy-mikor-jon-a-tavasz-napokon-belul-kiderul-idojaras

title: Nico_Harrison
extract: Nico Tyrone Harrison is an American professional basketball executive and former player who is the president of basketball operations and general manager of the Dallas Mavericks of the National Basketball Association (NBA).
text:
{{pp|small=yes}} {{Short description|American basketball player, executive (born 1972)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2019}} {{Infobox basketball biography | name = Nico Harrison | image = | position = President of Basketball Operations /
General Manager | team = Dallas Mavericks | height_ft = 6 | height_in = 5 | league = [[National Basketball Association|NBA]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|12|28}} | birth_place = [[Seattle]], Washington, U.S. | high_school = [[Tigard High School|Tigard]] ([[Tigard, Oregon]]) | college = *[[Army Black Knights men's basketball|Army]] (1991–1992) *[[Montana State Bobcats men's basketball|Montana State]] (1993–1996) | draft_year = 1996 | career_start = 1996 | career_end = 2001 | career_position = [[Forward (basketball)|Forward]] | years1 = 1996–1997 | team1 = [[Leuven Bears]] | years2 = 1997–1998 | team2 = [[Black Hills Posse]] | years3 = 1998–2000 | team3 = [[Sun Rockers Shibuya|Hitachi Honsha Rising Sun]]| | highlights = '''As player:''' *3× First-team All-[[Big Sky Conference|Big Sky]] (1993-1996) *[[Patriot League]] All-Freshman team (1992) }} '''Nico Tyrone Harrison''' (born December 28, 1972) is an American professional [[basketball]] executive and former player who is the president of basketball operations and general manager of the [[Dallas Mavericks]] of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA). After playing college basketball at [[Army Black Knights men's basketball|West Point]] and [[Montana State Bobcats men's basketball|Montana State]], Harrison played professional basketball in [[Belgium]], [[Japan]], the [[Continental Basketball Association]], and [[Lebanon]] for 5 years. In 2002, Harrison began a 19-year career at [[Nike, Inc.]], rising to Nike's Vice President of North American basketball operations. In 2021, Harrison was appointed as the general manager and president of basketball operations for the Dallas Mavericks, succeeding [[Donnie Nelson]]. ==Early life== Harrison was born on December 28, 1972 in [[Seattle]], Washington. He is the son of Steve and Christie Harrison ([[Birth name#Maiden and married names|née]] Martinez), and was the fourth of their five children. Harrison's parents divorced when he was five years old, and he split time between [[Spokane, Washington]], and [[Tigard, Oregon]], while growing up. As a child, Harrison played both [[American football]] and basketball, before shifting his focus solely to basketball in ninth grade. Harrison attended [[Tigard High School]] after determining it would be his best opportunity to earn a college basketball scholarship.{{cite news |last=Townsend |first=Brad |date=2021-09-27 |title=No more mystery: Inside Nico Harrison's circuitous journey to becoming Mavericks GM |url=https://www.dallasnews.com/sports/mavericks/2021/09/27/montana-middle-east-mavericks-nico-harrisons-previous-stops-prepared-him-to-be-gm/ |access-date=September 28, 2021 |work=[[The Dallas Morning News]] |publisher=}} At Tigard, he was a multi-sport athlete and became a star basketball player. ==College career== Harrison was recruited by [[Pac-10]] schools, but a broken ankle and torn thumb cartilage over his final two years of high school raised durability questions. Only [[West Point]] continued to recruited him. In his freshman year of college in 1991, Harrison averaged 9.7 points and 3.8 rebounds per game for the [[Army Black Knights men's basketball|Black Knights]]. He was selected to the [[Patriot League]] All-Freshman team in 1992..{{cite web |title=Nico Harrison College Stats |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cbb/players/nico-harrison-1.html |website=Sports Reference |access-date=February 2, 2025}} After one year at West Point, Harrison transferred to [[Montana State University]].{{cite web |title=Hall of Fame - Montana State University Athletics |url=https://msubobcats.com/honors/hall-of-fame |website=Montana State University |access-date=February 3, 2025}} Due to [[NCAA]] transfer rules, Harrison was required to sit out of the [[1992–93 NCAA Division I men's basketball season|1992-93 NCAA season]]. In three seasons with the [[Montana State Bobcats men's basketball|Bobcats]] between 1993 and 1996, Harrison scored over 1000 points, averaging 12 points per game, 2.4 assists per game, and 4.2 rebounds per game. In his senior year in 1996, Harrison helped lead the Bobcats to the [[1996 NCAA Division I men's basketball tournament|NCAA tournament]].{{cite web |title=A Quarter-Century Later, Danny Sprinkle is Again Poised to Lead Montana State into a Big Sky Championship Game |url=https://msubobcats.com/news/2021/3/13/mens-basketball-a-quarter-century-later-danny-sprinkle-is-again-poised-to-lead-montana-state-into-a-big-sky-championship-game |website=Montana S
trending_reason: The Nico Harrison article is trending on Wikipedia due to his increasing prominence as the president of basketball operations and general manager for the Dallas Mavericks, particularly following recent team developments.

title: Groundhog_Day_(film)
extract: Groundhog Day is a 1993 American fantasy comedy film directed by Harold Ramis from a screenplay by him and Danny Rubin. Starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, and Chris Elliott, it tells the story of a cynical television weatherman covering the annual Groundhog Day event in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, who becomes trapped in a time loop, forcing him to relive February 2 repeatedly. The film also features Stephen Tobolowsky, Brian Doyle-Murray, Marita Geraghty, Angela Paton, Rick Ducommun, Rick Overton, and Robin Duke in supporting roles.

title: Jey_Uso
extract: Joshua Samuel Fatu is an American professional wrestler. He is signed to WWE, where he performs on the Raw brand under the ring name Jey Uso. He is a member of the Anoaʻi family of Samoan professional wrestlers.
text:
{{short description|American professional wrestler (born 1985)}} {{Use American English|date=August 2023}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2023}} {{Infobox professional wrestler |name = Jey Uso |image = Jey Uso 2024 (cropped).jpg |caption = Uso in 2024 |birthname = Joshua Samuel Fatu |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1985|08|22}} |birth_place = [[San Francisco]], [[California]], U.S.{{cite web|url=http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/profiles/j/jey-uso.html|title=Jey Uso|access-date=July 24, 2010|publisher=Online World of Wrestling|archive-date=June 5, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120605030452/http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/profiles/j/jey-uso.html|url-status=live}} | alma_mater = [[University of West Alabama]] |spouse = {{Marriage|Takecia Travis|2015}} |children = 2 |parents = [[Rikishi (wrestler)|Solofa Fatu Jr.]] (father) |family = [[Anoaʻi family|Anoaʻi]] |names = '''Jey Uso'''
Josh Fatu
Joshua Fatu
Jules Uso{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/05312010/mainarticle|title=Shooting Star-Spangled Raw|date=May 31, 2010|last=Adkins|first=Greg|access-date=July 24, 2010|publisher=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|archive-date=November 6, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191106100844/https://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/archive/05312010/mainarticle|url-status=live}} |height = 6 ft 2 in{{cite web|title=Jey Uso|publisher=WWE|access-date=Sep 6, 2023|url= https://www.wwe.com/superstars/Jey-Uso}} |weight = 242 lb |billed = San Francisco, California{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/smackdown/jeyuso/|title=Jey Uso Bio|access-date=April 27, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]|archive-date=March 9, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120309050035/http://www.wwe.com/superstars/smackdown/jeyuso|url-status=live}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/smackdown/jimmyuso/|title=Jimmy Uso Bio|access-date=April 27, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]|archive-date=January 1, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120101215006/http://www.wwe.com/superstars/smackdown/jimmyuso|url-status=live}} |trainer = [[Rikishi (wrestler)|Rikishi]]
Wild Samoan Training Center
[[Florida Championship Wrestling]] |debut = June 8, 2007 }} '''Joshua Samuel Fatu''' (born August 22, 1985) is an American [[professional wrestler]]. He is signed to [[WWE]], where he performs on the [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]] [[WWE brand extension|brand]] under the [[ring name]] '''Jey Uso'''. He is a member of the [[Anoaʻi family]] of [[Samoan Islands|Samoan]] professional wrestlers. Trained since childhood by his father, [[WWE Hall of Fame]]r [[Rikishi (wrestler)|Rikishi]], Fatu debuted in 2008, before joining WWE's then-[[Farm team (professional wrestling)|developmental territory]] [[Florida Championship Wrestling]] (FCW) in 2010, and wrestled as '''Jules Uso''' alongside his twin brother, [[Jimmy Uso|Jimmy]], as [[The Usos]], where they became [[FCW Florida Tag Team Championship|FCW Florida Tag Team Champions]]. They were moved to the main roster later that year. While on the main roster, they have been [[Manager (professional wrestling)|managed]] by their cousin [[Tamina Snuka]], and Jimmy's wife, [[Naomi (wrestler)|Naomi]].{{Cite journal|date=2018|url=http://dx.doi.org/10.5040/9781350971349|journal=Rock Step, Nonisolated Rock, and Isolated Rock|doi=10.5040/9781350971349|title=Rock Step, Nonisolated Rock, and Isolated Rock|access-date=February 2, 2021|archive-date=February 17, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230217144739/https://www.humankineticslibrary.com/video?docid=HKL_5687395132001&tocid=HKL_file_5687395132001|url-status=live }} From July 2021 to June 2023, he was part of the villainous stable [[The Bloodline (professional wrestling)|The Bloodline]] with his first cousin once removed and group leader [[Roman Reigns]] and his brothers Jimmy and [[Solo Sikoa]]. During his time as part of The Usos, Fatu won the award of holding the record for the longest male tag team championship reign in WWE history at 622 days, which was accomplished in their fifth reign with the [[WWE SmackDown Tag Team Championship]].{{Cite web |title=SmackDown Tag Team Championship |url=https://www.wwe.com/titlehistory/smackdown-tag-team-championship |access-date=2023-04-02 |website=WWE |language=en}} They are overall eight-time [[Tag team championship|tag team champions]] in WWE, capturing the [[WWE Raw Tag Team Championship]] [[List of WWE Raw Tag Team Champions|three times]] and winning the [[Slammy Award]] for Tag Team of the Year in both 2014 and 2015. In 2017, they won the SmackDown Tag Team Championship on three occasions, followed by a fourth reign in 2019 an

title: Punxsutawney_Phil
extract: Punxsutawney Phil is a groundhog residing in Young Township near Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, United States, who is the central figure in Punxsutawney's annual Groundhog Day celebration.
text:
{{Short description|Groundhog Day figure}}
[[File:Punxsutawney Phil 2018 (cropped).jpg|alt=Groundhog Day 2025|thumb|Phil being held by a member of the Inner Circle on February 2, 2018]]
'''Punxsutawney Phil''' ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|p|ʌ|ŋ|k|s|ə|ˈ|t|ɔː|n|i}}) is a [[groundhog]] residing in [[Young Township, Jefferson County, Pennsylvania|Young Township]] near [[Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania]], United States, who is the central figure in Punxsutawney's annual [[Groundhog Day]] celebration.

== Folklore ==
On February 2 each year,<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url=https://www.pennlive.com/life/2020/01/groundhog-day-2020-guide-punxsutawney-phil-facts-tips-for-going-to-gobblers-knob-and-more.html|title=Groundhog Day 2020 Guide: Punxsutawney Phil facts, tips for going to Gobbler's Knob and more|date=2020-01-28|website=pennlive|language=en|access-date=2020-02-12|archive-date=2020-02-12|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200212205702/https://www.pennlive.com/life/2020/01/groundhog-day-2020-guide-punxsutawney-phil-facts-tips-for-going-to-gobblers-knob-and-more.html|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania|Punxsutawney]] holds a civic festival with music and food. During the ceremony, which begins well before the winter sunrise, Phil emerges from his temporary home on Gobbler's Knob, located in a rural area about {{convert|2|mi|0}} southeast of the town. According to the tradition, if Phil sees his shadow and returns to his hole, he has predicted six more weeks of [[winter]]-like weather.<ref name="auto" /> If Phil does not see his shadow, he has predicted an "early [[spring (season)|spring]]."<ref name="FAQ">{{cite web |title=Groundhog.org FAQ |work=Groundhog.org |url=http://www.groundhog.org/ |access-date=2009-02-02 |archive-date=2012-07-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120717053947/http://www.groundhog.org/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Punxsutawney's event is the most famous of many Groundhog Day festivals held in the United States and Canada. The event formally began in 1887, although its roots go back even further.<ref name="Staff">{{Cite web|url=https://www.history.com/news/groundhog-day-history-and-facts|title=Groundhog Day: History and Facts|website=History.com|language=en|access-date=2020-02-12|archive-date=2020-02-06|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200206214521/https://www.history.com/news/groundhog-day-history-and-facts|url-status=live}}</ref>

The event is based upon a communal light-hearted [[suspension of disbelief]] which extends to the assertion that the same groundhog has been making predictions since the 19th century.

The event is organized by the "Inner Circle" – recognizable by their [[top hat]]s and [[tuxedo (clothing)|tuxedos]] – who ostensibly communicate with Phil to receive his prediction.
The vice president of the Inner Circle prepares two scrolls in advance of the actual ceremony, one proclaiming six more weeks of winter and one proclaiming an early spring. At daybreak on February 2, Punxsutawney Phil awakens from his burrow on Gobbler's Knob, is helped to the top of the stump by his handlers, and purportedly explains to the president of the Inner Circle, in a language known as "Groundhogese",<ref name="Staff" /> whether he has seen his shadow. The president of the Inner Circle, the only person able to understand Groundhogese through his possession of an ancient [[acacia]] wood cane, then interprets Phil's message, and directs the vice president to read the proper scroll to the crowd gathered on Gobbler's Knob and the masses of "phaithphil phollowers" tuned in to live broadcasts around the world.<ref>{{Cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lKQhYPcNhx0 |title=Every Day Is Groundhog Day For Punxsutawney Phil’s Caretakers {{!}} TODAY Original |date=2020-02-01 |last=TODAY |access-date=2025-01-15 |via=YouTube}}</ref>

Outside of Groundhog Day, Phil resides with a mate, Phyllis, at the Punxsutawney Memorial Library in a climate-controlled environment. In March 2024, the Inner Circle announced that Phil had sired two babies, the first time in the history of the event that such a siring had happened; the birth surprised the Inner Circle, which had assumed that groundhogs do not breed in captivity. As a result of the births, the family will move permanently to Gobbler's Knob. The Inner Circle disowned the babies from ever inheriting their father's position.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-03-27 |title=Punxsutawney Phil surprises, starts family with 2 baby groundhogs |url=https://www.abc27.com/pennsylvania/exclusive-punxsutawney-phil-surprises-starts-family-with-2-baby-groundhogs/ |access-date=2024-03-28 |website=ABC27 |language=en-US}}</ref>

== Punxsutawney Phil canon ==
The practices and lore of Punxsutawney Phil's predictions are predicated on a light-hearted suspension of disbelief by those involved. According to the lore, there is only one Phil, and all other groundhogs are impostors.<ref name="FunFacts" /> It is claimed that this one groundhog has lived to make w

'''Abhishek Sharma''' (born 4 September 2000) is an Indian international [[cricket]]er who plays for the [[India national cricket team|national team]]. He made his debut against Zimbabwe in July 2024.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Abhishek Sharma, Dhruv Jurel, Riyan Parag make T20I debuts for India |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/amp/sports/cricket/story/zimbabwe-vs-india-first-t20i-abhishek-sharma-riyan-parag-dhruv-jurel-debuts-harare-2563270-2024-07-06 |work=India Today}}</ref> His maiden T20I century came in his second match.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Raj |first1=Pratyush |date=7 July 2024 |title=Abhishek Sharma's father: After 1st match, I reminded him six-hitting was what led to India call-up |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/cricket/abhishek-sharmas-father-after-1st-match-i-reminded-him-six-hitting-was-what-led-to-india-call-up-9438838/ |access-date=8 July 2024 |work=The Indian Express |language=en}}</ref> He plays as an [[Batting order (cricket)|opening batter]] and a [[Spin bowling|spinner]]. In domestic cricket, he represents  [[Punjab cricket team (India)|Punjab]] and in the [[Indian Premier League]], he plays for [[Sunrisers Hyderabad]].<ref name="Bio">{{Cite web|url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/india/content/player/1070183.html |title=Abhishek Sharma |work=ESPNcricinfo |access-date=26 February 2017}}</ref>

title: Dallas_Mavericks
extract: The Dallas Mavericks are an American professional basketball team based in Dallas. The Mavericks compete in the National Basketball Association (NBA) as a member of the Southwest Division of the Western Conference. The team plays its home games at American Airlines Center, which it shares with the National Hockey League's Dallas Stars.

title: David_Hogg
extract: David Miles Hogg is an American gun control activist and politician, serving as vice chair of the Democratic National Committee since 2025. He rose to prominence during the 2018 United States gun violence protests as a student survivor of the Stoneman Douglas High School shooting, helping lead several high-profile protests, marches, and boycotts, including the boycott of The Ingraham Angle. He has also been a target and scapegoat of several conspiracy theories.

'''Darren Jason Watkins Jr.''' (born January 21, 2005), known online as '''IShowSpeed''' or '''Speed''', is an American [[YouTuber]] and [[online streamer]]. He is known for his variety live streams that showcase dramatic and energetic behavior, as well as his [[Lifestreaming #Lifecasting|IRL]] streams in worldwide locations.

Watkins registered his YouTube channel in 2016, where he began posting gaming content. He started gaining online attention in 2021 due to his ill-mannered personality and statements. An incident of [[sexual harassment]] resulted in him being banned from [[Twitch (service)|Twitch]], after which he began streaming on [[YouTube]] full-time. In 2022, he began shifting focus towards [[association football|soccer]]-related content, becoming an avid supporter of [[Cristiano Ronaldo]], commonly revolving his content around his support for the footballer.<ref>{{Cite web |date=March 30, 2024 |title=IShowSpeed buys its first supercar featuring CR7 |url=https://www.marca.com/en/technology/gaming/2024/03/30/66086804268e3e40328b4573.html |access-date=July 5, 2024 |website=MARCA|archive-date=August 16, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240816041631/https://www.marca.com/en/technology/gaming/2024/03/30/66086804268e3e40328b4573.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Bayliss |first=Jake |date=June 15, 2024 |title=IShowSpeed's wild life – fireworks in house, e-dating scandal, Ronaldo obsession |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/ishowspeed-life-cristiano-ronaldo-youtube-32997828 |access-date=July 5, 2024 |website=The Mirror|archive-date=September 21, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240921134051/https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/ishowspeed-life-cristiano-ronaldo-youtube-32997828 |url-status=live }}</ref> 

Watkins has also pursued a recording career. He signed with [[Warner Records]] to release his 2022 [[Single (music)|single]] "[[World Cup (song)|World Cup]]", which charted in several countries. He was named Breakout Streamer of the Year at the [[12th Streamy Awards]] in 2022,<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Escandon |first=Rosa |title=YouTube's Streamy Awards Announce 2022 Noms |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/rosaescandon/2022/10/27/youtubes-streamy-awards-announce-2022-noms/ |access-date=March 7, 2023 |website=Forbes|archive-date=March 7, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230307182659/https://www.forbes.com/sites/rosaescandon/2022/10/27/youtubes-streamy-awards-announce-2022-noms/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Truder |first=Morgan |date=December 5, 2022 |title=Kai Cenat and IShowSpeed Take Home Major Awards at Youtube Streamys |url=https://www.videogamer.com/news/2022-streamys-winners/ |access-date=March 7, 2023 |website=VideoGamer.com |archive-date=December 7, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221207194400/https://www.videogamer.com/news/2022-streamys-winners/ |url-status=live}}</ref> and Streamer of the Year at the [[2024 Streamer Awards]].<ref name=":10">{{Cite web |last=Brigstock |first=Jake |title=Streamer Awards 2024: IShowSpeed named streamer of the year |url=https://www.indy100.com/viral/streamer-awards-2024-ishowspeed-kai-cenat |website=[[The Independent#Indy100|Indy100]]}}</ref><ref name=":9" />

title: Elimination_Chamber:_Toronto
extract: Elimination Chamber: Toronto is an upcoming professional wrestling event produced by the American company WWE. It will be the 15th Elimination Chamber event and will take place on Saturday, March 1, 2025, at the Rogers Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The event will air via pay-per-view (PPV) and livestreaming and will be held for wrestlers from the promotion's Raw and SmackDown brand divisions. The event is based around the Elimination Chamber match, a type of multi-person elimination-based Steel Cage match in which championships or future opportunities at championships are at stake.
text:
{{short description|2025 WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming event}} {{use mdy dates|date=November 2024}} {{Infobox wrestling event |name = Elimination Chamber: Toronto |image = Elimination Chamber - Toronto poster.jpg |caption = Promotional poster featuring [[John Cena]] |tagline = |promotion = [[WWE]] |brand = [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]]
[[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown]] |date = March 1, 2025 |attendance = |venue = [[Rogers Centre]] |city = [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]] |wwenlast = [[NXT Vengeance Day (2025)|Vengeance Day]] |wwennext = [[NXT Stand & Deliver (2025)|Stand & Deliver]] |event = [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] |lastevent2 = [[Elimination Chamber: Perth|2024]] |nextevent2 = }} '''Elimination Chamber: Toronto''' (known as '''No Escape''' in Germany) is an upcoming [[professional wrestling]] [[List of WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming supercards|event]] produced by the American company [[WWE]]. It will be the 15th [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] event and will take place on Saturday, March 1, 2025, at the [[Rogers Centre]] in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]]. The event will air via [[pay-per-view]] (PPV) and [[livestreaming]] and will be held for wrestlers from the promotion's [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]] and [[SmackDown (WWE brand)|SmackDown]] [[WWE brand extension|brand divisions]]. The event is based around the [[Elimination Chamber]] match, a type of multi-person elimination-based [[Steel Cage match]] in which championships or future opportunities at championships are at stake. This will be the first Elimination Chamber event in Toronto and the first WWE event to be held at the Rogers Centre since [[WrestleMania X8]] in 2002 when it was still known as the SkyDome. It will also be the second Elimination Chamber event in Canada after the [[Elimination Chamber (2023)|2023 edition]] and the fourth consecutive Elimination Chamber to be held outside of the United States. This will also be the final Elimination Chamber appearance of [[John Cena]] due to his retirement from professional wrestling at the end of 2025. ==Production== [[File:Toronto - ON - Rogers Centre2.jpg|thumb|upright|250px|The 2025 [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] will be held at the [[Rogers Centre]] in [[Toronto, Ontario, Canada]], which will be [[WWE]]'s first event in the stadium since [[WrestleMania X8]] in 2002.]] ===Background=== [[WWE Elimination Chamber|Elimination Chamber]] is a [[professional wrestling]] [[List of WWE pay-per-view and livestreaming supercards|event]] first produced by the American promotion [[WWE]] in 2010. It has been held every year since, except in 2016, generally in February. The [[Gimmick (professional wrestling)|concept]] of the event is that one or two [[Card (sports)#Main event|main event matches]] are contested inside the [[Elimination Chamber]], which is a type of multi-person elimination-based [[Steel Cage match]] in which championships or future opportunities at championships are at stake.{{cite web|url=https://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/2010/exclusives/chamberrules|title=Elimination Chamber Match rules|access-date=February 2, 2010|work=[[World Wrestling Entertainment]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110208084141/https://www.wwe.com/shows/eliminationchamber/history/2010/exclusives/chamberrules|archive-date=February 8, 2011}} Announced on November 8, 2024, the 15th Elimination Chamber event, titled as Elimination Chamber: Toronto, is scheduled to take place on Saturday, March 1, 2025, at [[Rogers Centre]] in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]], and will feature wrestlers from the [[Raw (WWE brand)|Raw]] and [[SmackDown]] [[WWE brand extension|brand divisions]].{{cite web |title=WWE Elimination Chamber 2025 Announced For Toronto |url=https://411mania.com/wrestling/wwe-elimination-chamber-2025-toronto/ |date=November 8, 2024 |last=Thomas |first=Jeremy |work=411Mania |access-date=November 8, 2024}} This will mark the second Elimination Chamber event to be held in Canada, after [[Elimination Chamber (2023)|2023]], and the fourth consecutive to be held outside of the United States, after the [[Elimination Chamber (2022)|2022]], 2023, and [[Elimination Chamber: Perth|2024]] events, which were held in [[Saudi Arabia]], Canada ([[Montreal]]), and [[Australia]], respectively. This will also mark WWE's first event to be held at the Rogers Centre since [[WrestleMania X8]] in 2002 when the stadium was still known as the SkyDome. This will also be the second Elimination Chamber event to have a subtitle named after its host city and to take place in an outdoor venue, both after 2024.{{cite news|last=Lambert|first=Jeremy|title=WWE E
trending_reason: The Elimination Chamber: Toronto article is trending on Wikipedia as anticipation builds for this highly significant WWE event, marking the first Elimination Chamber match in Toronto since its inception and the final appearance of John Cena in the event.
